source.bc993514:
#Add a few attributes like title,legend,color
#scatter plot

name = ['A','B','C', 'D','E']
science_marks = [98,89,78,67,90]
maths_marks = [58,85,63,28,54]

plt.scatter(name,science_marks, color ='green', label = 'Science')
plt.scatter(name,maths_marks, color ='blue' , label = 'Maths')

plt.title('Students Marks')
plt.xlabel('Name')
plt.ylabel('Marks')
plt.legend()
plt.show()

y=[50,90,10,51,8]

plt.bar(x,y,color='Red')
plt.title('Atmospheric air')
plt.xlabel('Types of gases')

source.c4ebfe0e:
#combining scatter and line plot


name = ['A','B','C', 'D','E']
marks = [98,89,78,67,90]

plt.scatter(name,marks,color ='blue')
plt.plot(name,marks, color = 'green')

plt.title('Students Marks')
plt.xlabel('Name')
plt.ylabel('Marks')
plt.show()
source.326185cd:
#Using linewidth

x= range(2001,2011)
y=[ 22,34,43,32,45,89,32,67,64,76]
z=[ 34,45,20,34,15,78,65,76,87,98]


plt.figure(figsize=(12,5))
plt.plot(x,y,color='red',label = 'benze',linewidth= 4)
plt.plot(x,z,color='blue',label = 'audi',linewidth= 4)

plt.title('Audi vs Benze yearly production')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Production in 1000s')
plt.xticks(x)
plt.legend()
plt.show()
source.1aca1074:
#Neon light plotting

colors = ['#08F7FE','#FE53BB']
plt.style.use("dark_background")


x= range(2001,2011)
y=[ 22,34,43,32,45,89,32,67,64,76]
z=[ 34,45,20,34,15,78,65,76,87,98]

plt.figure(figsize =(10,5))
plt.plot(x,y,marker='o', color=colors[0], linewidth = 2)
plt.plot(x,z,marker='o', color=colors[1], linewidth = 2)
plt.xticks(x)
plt.show()
source.4b8beac2:
#Histogram



y= [ 1,5,3,10,10,10,6,5,4,3,7,8,7,6,5,4,3,2,1,3,4,5,5,6,7,8,9,9,0,8,6,5,5,4]
bins= range(0,11)

plt.hist(y,bins,histtype='bar',rwidth=0.8,color='blue')

plt.title('frequency bandwidth')
plt.xlabel('frequency')
plt.ylabel('number of times')
source.e8ccd9d2:
#pie chart

labels = 'China', 'India' ,'Canada','Korea'
sizes = [15, 30, 45, 10]
explode = (0, 0.1, 0, 0)


plt.style.use('default')
fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%',
        shadow=True, startangle=90)
ax1.axis('equal')
plt.show()
source.38815f21:
#using grid 

x = np.arange(0,4*np.pi-1,0.1)   # start,stop,step
y = np.sin(x)
z = np.cos(x)


plt.grid()
plt.plot(x,y,x,z,linewidth=4)
plt.legend(['Sin','Cos'])
plt.show()
source.394a0eee:
#plotting rainbow colors in line 


x = np.arange(7)
colors = ["red", "orange", "yellow", "green", "blue", "indigo", "violet"]

for i in range(7):
  y = x*i
  plt.plot(x,y,linewidth = 3, c = colors[i])

plt.legend(range(1,9)) 
plt.show()
source.447094f8:
#stacked barplot

labels = ['G1', 'G2', 'G3', 'G4', 'G5']
men_means = [20, 34, 30, 35, 27]
women_means = [25, 32, 34, 20, 25]

x = np.arange(len(labels))  
width = 0.35  

fig, ax = plt.subplots()
rects1 = ax.bar(x - width/2, men_means, width, label='Men')
rects2 = ax.bar(x + width/2, women_means, width, label='Women')


ax.set_ylabel('Scores')
ax.set_title('Scores by group and gender')
ax.set_xticks(x)
ax.set_xticklabels(labels)
ax.legend()

ax.bar_label(rects1, padding=3)
ax.bar_label(rects2, padding=3)

fig.tight_layout()

plt.show()
source.70e72741:
#plotting a math func (y = x2 (x squarr))


x = np.linspace(1,5,10)
y = x**2

plt.plot(x,y,color ='Blue',linewidth = 5)
plt.title("Line graph")
plt.ylabel('Y axis')
plt.xlabel('X axis')
plt.show()

x = np.linspace(-3,3,100)

plt.plot(x,y,linewidth = 2)
plt.show()

t = np.arange(0,2*np.pi, 0.1)
x = 16*np.sin(t)**3.
y = 13*np.cos(t)-5*np.cos(2*t)-2*np.cos(3*t)-np.cos(4*t)
plt.plot(x,y)
plt.show()

source.fe630bf6:
fig ,ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2,ncols=4-1,figsize=(12,6))
fig.tight_layout(pad=3.0)
ax[0][0].plot(a4,10*a1,linewidth =10,color='Black')
ax[0][0].plot(a4,1*a1,linewidth =10,color='Black')
ax[0][0].plot(5*a1,a4,linewidth =10,color = 'Black')

ax[0][1].plot(x1,y1,color = 'Black',linewidth = 7)

draw_circle = plt.Circle((0.5, 0.5), 0.3,color = 'Black')
ax[0][2].add_artist(draw_circle)

ax[1][0].plot(li2,li1,linewidth = 10,color='Black')

ax[1][1].plot(x,y,linewidth = 10,color = 'Red')


ax[1][2].plot(aa1,bb2,color = 'Black',linewidth = 10)
source.cecb71b1:
fig ,ax = plt.subplots(nrows=1,ncols=7,figsize=(15,4))
fig.tight_layout(pad=3.0)
ax[0].plot(a4,10*a1,linewidth =10,color='Black')
ax[0].plot(a4,1*a1,linewidth =10,color='Black')
ax[0].plot(5*a1,a4,linewidth =10,color = 'Black')

#rectangular hyperbola
ax[1].plot(x1,y1,color = 'Black',linewidth = 7)

#x2 + y2 = a2
draw_circle = plt.Circle((0.5, 0.5), 0.3,color = 'Black')
ax[2].add_artist(draw_circle)

#linear plotting
ax[3].plot(li2,li1,linewidth = 10,color='Black')


ax[4].plot(a4,10*a1,linewidth =10,color = 'Black')
ax[4].plot(a4,1*a1,linewidth =10,color = 'Black')
ax[4].plot(a4,6*a1,linewidth =10,color = 'Black')
ax[4].plot(1*a1,a4,linewidth =10,color = 'Black')

#sin and cos function integrated
ax[5].plot(x,y,linewidth = 10,color = 'Red')

#parabola
ax[6].plot(aa1,bb2,color = 'Black',linewidth = 10)
plt.show()

source.a405e013: A bar chart or bar graph is a chart or graph that presents categorical data with rectangular bars with heights or lengths proportional to the values that they represent.
source.56987a33: A line plot is a graph that displays data using a number line.
source.e381ea35: A scatter plot is a type of plot or mathematical diagram using Cartesian coordinates to display values for typically two variables for a set of data.
